revised_title: Pressure-Concentration Equilibria Between Ferric Oxide and Silica Gels
tldr: The authors investigated the pressure-concentration equilibria between ferric oxide and silica gels and benzene under isothermal conditions. They confirmed the difference in adsorptive processes of these two analogous gels and used a unique experimental setup to determine equilibrium pressures between benzene vapor and solid adsorbents. This study contributes to understanding adsorption and catalytic action in gas-solid systems.
